meanings.definition: A sensational dramatic piece with exaggerated characters and exciting events intended to appeal to the emotions.
meanings.sent1: The school play was a melodrama filled with exaggerated characters and exciting events.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys watching melodramas because they always have exaggerated characters and exciting events.
meanings.sent3: The family picnic turned into a melodrama when Uncle Joe started pretending to be a superhero.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a melodrama, with each day bringing exaggerated characters and exciting events.
meanings.sent5: The melodrama of the storm unfolding outside made her heart race with excitement.

meanings.definition: Exaggerated or sensational behavior or events; emotional or sensational overreaction.
meanings.sent1: Her reaction to the spilled milk was a melodrama, complete with tears and wailing.
meanings.sent2: The argument at the party turned into a melodrama with shouting and dramatic gestures.
meanings.sent3: The melodrama of the cat chasing its own tail never failed to make them laugh.
meanings.sent4: The melodrama of the situation made her feel like she was in a soap opera.
meanings.sent5: His melodrama over losing his favorite toy was both amusing and endearing.
